climatePledgeFriendly.details: Compact by Design (Certified by Amazon) products remove excess air and water, which reduces the carbon footprint of shipping and packaging.

features: SAME CLEAN IN A NEW LOOK: We may have a new and improved look, but our laundry strips are still the same quality you expect. You may receive either package during the transition.

GENTLE FOR SENSITIVE SKIN: Not only are Tru Earth Eco-Strips laundry soap sheets incredibly convenient, we pride ourselves on safety and health. Tru Earth Eco-Strips are vegan-friendly, paraben-free and gentle enough for even the most sensitive skin.

NO PLASTIC JUGS: Our laundry detergent sheets' eco friendly design has a smaller carbon footprint than liquid or powder detergents. Its packaging uses no plastic jug, and its lightweight and small size is arthritis friendly and needs less space compared to traditional detergent.

NO MEASURING, NO MESS: Let’s face it. Traditional liquid laundry detergent can sometimes be messy, and takes up space. Measuring out detergent whether it is liquid or powder can result in spillage. With Tru Earth sheet laundry detergent, 1 strip equals 1 load - no measuring and nothing to spill.

UNCOMPROMISING CLEANING POWER: The best life hacks for laundry, these remove stains, restore colors, and brighten whites. Each strip of Tru Earth laundry detergent weighs just 3g - perfect compact gift for college students, for van and RV essentials, as a lightweight laundromat supplies kit, or as travel laundry soap for the perfect travel essentials set.

NO MORE WASTED SPACE: Tru Earth laundry detergent sheets travel well, as our innovative packaging conveniently fits into any carry-on luggage and is fully TSA-compliant. Save space at home with our ultra-efficient compact packaging; 400 loads worth of Tru Earth Eco-Strips takes up the same space as a single 100 load jug of the best laundry detergent liquid.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This laundry soap works great. No dyes or fragrance, no poisons, no plastic jugs. I’m happy to use a product that is environmentally safe — and it takes a LOT less shelf space than a jug or bottle or box.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These laundry detergent strips are great. Takes up less space on the shelf than the large plastic bottle of laundry detergent. I recommend these. I purchased the Linen Fresh scent and it’s a nice scent. Plan on ordering these again and again!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works well, no smell, package absorbs moisture and is expensive
reviews.reviewText: I really wanted to try this laundry soap when I saw it. What a great idea! No plastic jugs, no messy pouring, great for the environment. I wasn't sure if I trusted it to work well, so at first I used it occasionally for tough things and reserved the old standby for more delicate stuff. As time went on, I used it more and more for most things. But I still use the old standby here and there because this soap is expensive!The first package wasn't too successful as the soap squares became slimy sitting in the opened cardboard package in our laundry room. If your laundry setup is in a basement or damp area, as ours is, you may want to consider a plastic box to store the package in. We tried a ziplock bag, but that's a pain to open and close every time, so we got a shallow plastic container. I know, I know, this negates the purpose of these things, right? Well, at least one plastic box has less footprint than dozens of single-use detergent jugs. And it has to be practical. So that's my compromise. 5 stars for quality and innovation, 3 stars for impractical packaging for a laundry area, and 4 stars for added expense. 4 in all.Update 1/24: For the past 2 months, I bought 2 packs of these per month--and ran out. I will try ordering 3 packs next month. This is using the TruEarth for most of the loads we do, for just my husband and me, about a load a day in winter, when big loads (heavy clothing and lots of flannel) are washed. We are using 1 1/2 strips for these large loads, and only occasionally 1 strip for a medium.Not sure if this is sufficient soap because when they are in the dryer a short time, I can smell a dirty-dishtowel odor from the wet clothes. The clothes aren't extra dirty, so this is odd. I noticed one or two other reviewers noticed a smell, too.That's a lot of expense--about double--compared to the Arm & Hammer unscented we have always bought, and which does a great job. I think we will continue for one or two more months and decide if the extra expense is really worth it. If Arm & Hammer made unscented soap in sheets like Tru Earth instead of plastic jugs, I would buy that instead.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Tru Earth Compact Dry Laundry Detergent Sheets
reviews.reviewText: These sheets are absolutely wonderful. I bought the scent free. I love the fact that they are eco friendly and the packaging is recyclable. And, they get the clothes clean, as the strips are ultra concentrated! The price is right and delivery was quick and the packaging was just right. I will by this Tru Earth product for now on- no exceptions. Also, the product is hypoallergenic, paraben-free and phosphate-free. Last but not least, this product is distributed by a company in Midland, MI ... USA!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cleans well and smells fresh
reviews.reviewText: Not only that, but it gets rid of those clunky, heavy and polluting plastic bottles! Very convenient!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best one yet!
reviews.reviewText: We have been using the TruEarth laundry sheets now for quite a while. When you buy jugs of detergent, you are truly paying for a lot of water in the product. You also need to dispose of all those jugs. Even if you buy the smallest jug of the most highly concentrated soap, it is still a lot that goes to the dump over the years. And not enough of plastic jugs and bottles get recycled.First time my wife heard of these detergent sheets, she was excited. I was skeptical. How is it that we are truly only using THAT MUCH actual SOAP to wash a WHOLE LOAD? Took a bit for me to get used to just one half sheet works for a whole load. We DO sometimes add the whole sheet if we have been working outside a lot.We tried two other brands - she reacted to the first one with skin rashes everywhere. I reacted to the second one with a horrible rash on my feet from my socks. So our next attempt was TruEarth - my wife has super sensitive skin and immune system, while i do not. TruEarth is the ONLY one that has not caused either of us to have a problem. When she realized how neither of us reacted to TruEarth, she rewashed literally ALL our laundry in the first package and ordered more!We chose the unscented, which she loves, and it dissolves easily in warm or cold water in our top loading washing machine. I will say that when our WINTER water comes in and it is SUPER cold, the TruEarth sheets don't dissolve as easily and once or twice they left tiny blobs on a couple of articles of clothing. That was easily remedied by rewashing the load on a short cycle. It was also remedied by ALWAYS making sure in winter we toss the sheet into warm water before starting a whole load. This can easily be done by adding a little hot water into the washer first, pausing the cycle, adding the soap sheet, and when dissolved, switch the load to cold or warm and continue as a regular load. OR you can have a small container of hot water handy (she uses an old quart size yogurt or cottage cheese tub), place a sheet in, load the washer as usual, then dump the dissolved laundry soap into your washer just like you would a liquid detergent.I will say, this is not an issue for just TruEarth. My wife and I had to dissolve all three brands in warm or hot water when it was cold outside. But we DO live over 3,000 feet in the Appalachians and our winter water is LIKE ICE some days.Removing stains: this product is great at removing grass stains, dirt stains from the gardens, spilled foods (grease or oil need extra treatments, but that is normal for us), and even baby spit up. We haven't had to pretreat anything since starting to use TruEarth except for oil or grease stains. Oh, it also removes stench, stink and smells easily, too. Definitely a product we regularly recommend to family and friends.

reviews.reviewTitle: Smells great and does the job!
reviews.reviewText: Cheaper than buying in our local store. These smell great and get the job done! For small loads, I use half a sheet. For bigger loads usually 1 but sometimes 2 sheets.

Love it, works well and has a very delicate scent - I don't like overwhelming scents of the typical laundry detergents. I like that there is no plastic in the packaging and that it takes so little space - It's a great eco-friendly option

Recibes 8 hojas de 10 cms cuadrados. Hay líneas pero las perforaciones son pobres. Puedes separar por la mitad, pero luego tienes que doblar y cortar cada mitad para hacer tus tiras de 8 x 4, para igualar 32 tiras / carga. No es muy fácil de usar. Todavía no he hecho una carga pesada sucia, pero parece limpiar bastante bien.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 8, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Brilliant product. Cleans well, smells great. So easy to use. Great for taking up minimal space compared to bulky plastic containers. So straightforward to use - even for my sons who usually get confused between washing liquid and conditioner!! Only downside is the higher price you pay for being eco responsible (compared to my usual brand). Will still use it though

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 4, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Been through a box- laundry feels clean, looks clean- switched from method/ faith in nature and not noticed a difference in the cleaniness department.Lack of scent is disturbing to the brain as this is the first time I used scentless! I kept thinking it's not clean the first few times due to scent association but I'm used to it now. Clothes are defo cleaned!It's so compact and environmentally friendly as well and no more huge bottles of refill!
